event.title: 1837, the town of Madison was laid out

data.event: In 1837, the town of Madison was laid out by James R. Abernathy, who came from Fayette County, Kentucky.

event.title: now the Norfolk Southern railroad, built

data.event: The town continued to grow when the M.K. & T. Railroad, the Wabash, now the Norfolk Southern railroad, built from Hannibal to Moberly, was completed in 1872.
The town continued to grow when the M.K. & T. Railroad, the Wabash, now the Norfolk Southern railroad, built from Hannibal to Moberly, was completed in 1872.
